place.name: CARBURTON
place.gazetteerText: CARBURTON, a chapelry and a subdistrict in Worksop district, Notts. The chapelry is in Edwinstowe parish; and lies contiguous to Clumber Park, 4 miles SSE of Worksop r. station. Post Town, Worksop. Real property, £1,216. Pop., 177. Houses, 31. Carburton Lodge was the seat of Dr. Aldrich. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Edwinstowe in the diocese of Lincoln. The subdistrict contains also five other parishes and an extra-parochial tract. Acres, 18,440. Pop., 5,523. Houses, 1,096. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
